cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn W-NW tonight, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, then continue NW toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast, most likely Louisiana coast just east of the TX-LA border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect only for portions of Honduras and the Bay Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Caribbean coasts of Honduras, Yucatán Peninsula, then northern Gulf Coast from eastern TX through LA
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely at this stage (forecast guidance supports 2–4 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible if track shifts west toward Sabine Pass
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds late Mon–Tue; strongest gusts more likely east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center moves ashore east of Sabine Pass, a 1–3 ft surge could occur in Sabine Lake; >3 ft requires westward track shift
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain (2–4 in.) possible Tue–Wed as outer rainbands move inland
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief port closure or traffic restrictions possible during peak winds; localized flooding in low-lying dock areas
